page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO ABERDEEN.
page.content: Our study area is NW.of Aberdeen town centre.Aberdeen is called The Granite City or The Silver City because the old buildings are constructed in granite which sparkles silver in the sun.It is a booming town thanks to north sea oil. Aberdeen is the 3rd largest city in Scotland with 200,000 people.The main industries are oil, fishing,farming &tourism.There are 2 rivers,the Dee & the Don. Primary 7K of Scotstown School,Bridge of Don researched the information.We went out on site and wrote away,and in class we studied the area with maps.We used newspapers and local directories. We enjoyed going out on site because it was good fun.We saw things that we didn't know existed.We met people who told us interesting stories.The areas studied include Bankhead,Danestone, Dyce,Grandhome,Persley & Stoneywood.
